data.title: "Igpay Latin"
data.statement:
You must convert a given string [[s]], that <<only contains alphabetical and space characters>>, into a <<lowercase string>> of Pig Latin. There are a few basic rules for this clash:

1. If the <<first letter of a word is a vowel ({{a}}, {{e}}, {{i}}, {{o}}, {{u}})>> then <<add {{yay}} to the end of the word>>.
2. If the <<first letter of a word is a consonant>>, then keep moving along the word until you reach a <<vowel>>. If there is <<one consonant, move it to the end of the word and add {{ay}} to the end>>. If there are <<multiple consecutive consonants, move all of them to the end of the word and {{ay}} to the end>>.
3. Remember that the <<resulting string should be all lowercase.>>
4. <<Each word>> in [[s]] should be converted to Pig Latin <<separately>>.

Here are some examples:

<<{{Car}}: (first letter is consonant>>) => {{ar}} + {{c}} + {{ay}} => {{arcay}}
{{Chess}}: (first two letters are <<consonants>>) => {{ess}} + {{ch}} + {{ay}} => {{esschay}}
{{Apple}}: (first letter is <<vowel>>) => {{apple}} + {{yay}} => {{appleyay}}
{{A}}: (only letter is <<vowel>>) => {{a}} + {{yay}} => {{ayay}}>>

These links provide some helpful information on Pig Latin:
  https://www.dictionary.com/e/pig-latin
  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pig_Latin

testCases.title: A Fact
testCases.testIn: Pig Latin is not a real language
testCases.testOut: igpay atinlay isyay otnay ayay ealray anguagelay

testCases.title: Origins
testCases.testIn: Pig Latin was invented as a fun game for kids
testCases.testOut: igpay atinlay asway inventedyay asyay ayay unfay amegay orfay idskay

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn: one two three four five once i caught a fish alive
testCases.testOut: oneyay otway eethray ourfay ivefay onceyay iyay aughtcay ayay ishfay aliveyay

testCases.title: Rule 1
testCases.testIn: A simple rule is that if the first letter of the word is a vowel then add yay to the end
testCases.testOut: ayay implesay uleray isyay atthay ifyay ethay irstfay etterlay ofyay ethay ordway isyay ayay owelvay enthay addyay ayyay otay ethay endyay

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn: Hope you understand this rule cause its quite simple
testCases.testOut: opehay ouyay understandyay isthay uleray ausecay itsyay uiteqay implesay

testCases.title: Rule 2
testCases.testIn: Otherwise place each consecutive consonant at the end of the word and add ay to the end
testCases.testOut: otherwiseyay aceplay eachyay onsecutivecay onsonantcay atyay ethay endyay ofyay ethay ordway andyay addyay ayyay otay ethay endyay

testCases.title: Validator 5
testCases.testIn: Hope this rule also makes sense to you
testCases.testOut: opehay isthay uleray alsoyay akesmay ensesay otay ouyay

testCases.title: Validator 6
testCases.testIn: LETS DO SOME PIG LATIN OF LATIN
testCases.testOut: etslay oday omesay igpay atinlay ofyay atinlay

testCases.title: ellway oneday!
testCases.testIn: Congratulations YOU have CREATED A SOLUTION program FOR THIS CLASH WELL DONE
testCases.testOut: ongratulationscay ouyay avehay eatedcray ayay olutionsay ogrampray orfay isthay ashclay ellway oneday

data.stubGenerator:
read s:string(150)

write pig latin => igpay atinlay
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> The resulting string in Pig Latin, [[res]], <<in lowercase>>.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You must convert a given string s, that only contains alphabetical and space characters, into a lowercase string of Pig Latin. There are a few basic rules for this clash:

1. If the first letter of a word is a vowel (a, e, i, o, u) then add yay to the end of the word.
2. If the first letter of a word is a consonant, then keep moving along the word until you reach a vowel. If there is one consonant, move it to the end of the word and add ay to the end. If there are multiple consecutive consonants, move all of them to the end of the word and ay to the end.
3. Remember that the resulting string should be all lowercase.
4. Each word in s should be converted to Pig Latin separately.

Here are some examples:

Car: (first letter is consonant) => ar + c + ay => arcay
Chess: (first two letters are consonants) => ess + ch + ay => esschay
Apple: (first letter is vowel) => apple + yay => appleyay
A: (only letter is vowel) => a + yay => ayay>>

These links provide some helpful information on Pig Latin:
https://www.dictionary.com/e/pig-latin
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pig_Latin
Input
Line 1: A string, s.
Output
Line 1: The resulting string in Pig Latin, res, in lowercase.
Constraints
0 < length of s <= 150
0 < length of res <= 150
Example
Input
Pig Latin
Output
igpay atinlay
